poem:
"Morning, Separated by Borders and War"

Beneath the newspaper's black and white dance,
A tale of separation whispers - a girl in an airport,
A family fragmented, caught in courage's stance.
Across lines drawn in sand and ink, two worlds distort,
Her twenty-year whisper echoes through silence,
A sting in the heart, an unanswered report.
